questions.question: ……………. are useful devices.
questions.description: We do not use ‘the’ with plural nouns to talk about things in general.

questions.question: I love …………………
questions.description: We do not use ‘the’ with plural nouns to talk about things in general.

questions.question: ………………. birds can fly.
questions.description: When most means ‘the majority of’, it is used without the.

questions.question: Mother is in ……………… She has kidney trouble.
questions.description: We use 'the' with hospital only when the reference is to the building.

questions.question: Both …………….. are good at painting.
questions.description: We often leave out ‘the’ after both.

questions.question: All ……………… robbers have been arrested.
questions.description: We often leave out ‘the’ between all and a number.

questions.question: The number of …………….. has increased rapidly.
questions.description: ‘The’ is dropped after ‘the number of’ or ‘the amount of’.

questions.question: Who is that on ……………….?
questions.description: The article ‘the’ is common with the names of musical instruments.

questions.question: It is not easy to produce programs for …………….
questions.description: Articles are generally used with radio, cinema and theater.

questions.question: What …………….. idea!
questions.description: We use’a/an’ with singular countable nouns in exclamations after what.

questions.question: Can you get that cat off …………….?
questions.description: Articles are used with TV when the reference is to a television set.

questions.question: I am getting ……………
questions.description: 'A toothache' is more common in American English.
